meanings.definition: A synthetic dye used in biological staining.
meanings.sent1: The scientist used thionine to color the cells for observation.
meanings.sent2: The thionine dye helped highlight the different parts of the cell.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous student accidentally spilled thionine on the lab coat, creating a colorful mess.
meanings.sent4: Her artistic masterpiece resembled a canvas painted with thionine, vibrant and eye-catching.
meanings.sent5: The bright thionine dye made the cell structures stand out clearly under the microscope.

meanings.definition: A compound containing a thionine group.
meanings.sent1: The new compound synthesized in the lab contained thionine, giving it a unique property.
meanings.sent2: Researchers studied the effects of the thionine compound on different biological processes.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally added thionine to the recipe, resulting in a surprising chemical reaction.
meanings.sent4: The bond between them was as strong as the thionine group holding the compound together.
meanings.sent5: The distinct smell of thionine lingered in the air after the experiment.
